answers.answer: I'm 22 and my baby is 1.7 lbs. I wouldn't worry ultrasounds are not 100%. I has a friend and they said her baby was 7 lbs came out the next day at 9lbs! As long as the doctor is worried I wouldn't! If they thought you has a little problem your but would be in the hospital!You should be taking the test for gestational diabetes soon and one side affect is big babies. If your weight is good and you eat right then I'm sure ur fine!
At 24 weeks my daughter was estimated to weigh 4 pounds I'm now 36 weeks at 8. The baby could even out or continue to be bigger. And ultrasounds can be off by a full pound either direction.
I did one at 27 weeks and baby was 2.3. Yours sounds big! Good luck with that lol

question: Isn't my baby too big for my how far along I am?  The dr did the ultrasound and said that's how big is he. .I asked if that was normal & she said yes. . But every where I read says a baby should only be one pound at this point. I'm not over weight or even very big at all--haven't even switched to maternity clothes. . Help!
title: 23 weeks & 2 lb 9 oz baby! ?
